p: Native Mycoplasma arthritidis mitogen (MAM) was purified as described elsewhere [ 38]. Briefly, M. arthritidis strain PG6 (ATCC 19611) was grown to senescence in autoclaved modified Edward-Hayflick medium, which was then subjected to (NH 4) 2SO 4 fractionation. This was followed by sequential rounds of gel filtration and cation-exchange chromatography prior to the final purification of MAM by fast protein liquid chromatography.
